name: sfchronicle
sfchronicle
text:
Everything about this July 4 was a little different

Most everything was closed, canceled, or hard to get at if open. Sitting on the beach or a park lawn was possible for the masked and the socially distant. Parking nearby, in most cases, wasn‚Äôt.

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
The @Athletics held their first workout since baseball's shutdown. Pitchers and catchers worked in staggered groups, coaches maintained their distance, masks were de rigueur. 

‚ÄúEverything is going to be different,‚Äù manager Bob Melvin said. https://t.co/SeyHYqlM5e

name: sfchronicle
text:
At the Giants' full-speed batting practice, Buster Posey was particularly impressed by pitcher Logan Webb, the 23-year-old who debuted last season and was vying for the fifth spot in the rotation when the shutdown began.

https://t.co/UyBEIAGcsO

name: sfchronicle
text:
Giants management already promised that it won‚Äôt be a traditional five-man rotation in which the starters throw a bunch of innings. Openers could be used far more often, with ‚Äúbulk‚Äù pitchers to follow, or a couple of guys tossing three innings apiece.

https://t.co/7sGuSAbUt0

name: sfchronicle
text: Firefighters contained a a grass fire at San Francisco's McLaren park that burned through four acres of brush and hillside. https://t.co/N1h8wfp8xL

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: Grass fires flare up across San Francisco ‚Äî in McLaren Park, Hunters Point and North Beach. At least one of them is linked to illegal fireworks.  https://t.co/xNZI0jOokM

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @rachelswan: "It's burning down the city." Illegal fireworks cause fires to erupt through San Francisco -- esp the Bayview, where blazes charred wetlands and firefighters fought to save an RV and homeless encampment. Check for updates. https://t.co/QPreK9SA3u

name: sfchronicle
text:
Firefighters in the Bayview saved a row of motor homes from a five-acre fire caused by fireworks. No injuries were reported.

‚ÄúIf you will, please consider not using fireworks,‚Äù said SFFD Lt. Jonathan Baxter. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs burning down the city, it‚Äôs not nice." https://t.co/pj16vprlNH

name: sfchronicle
text:
Grass fires, many linked to illegal fireworks on the Fourth of July, flared across the Bay Area, straining firefighter resources and leading authorities to beg on social media for the explosions to stop.

https://t.co/MEQnPVQR5L
